content:
Prova a fare queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]
creator: @next

content:
Negli ultimi mesi è stata segnalata da più utenti l’incompatibilità della PEC di Aruba con Thunderbird: - https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1474151 - https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1442158 - https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1404971 Alla luce di questo non è chiaro se il servizio possa essere utilizzato con Thunderbird o meno.

Se invece hai attiva l'autenticazione a 2 fattori, ricordati che non devi usare la password dell'account ma una generata appositamente, come spiega anche la guida di Aruba -> https://guide.pec.it/gestione-account-pec/password/programmi-di-posta.aspx
creator: @next

content: My suggestion; - click to 'account settings' - scroll down left side to 'Outgoing servers SMTP) and click enter - create a new SMTP server setting for the account - incoming: outlook.office365.com, port 993, SSL/TLS, Oauth2 (assuming IMAP) - outgoing: smtp.office365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, Oauth2 - put a unique description in Description field and save - now, while still in 'account settings' click the name of the account and on that pane, on bottom line is link to SMTP server. click and locate the entry with the unique name you created. you now have your smtp server again,
creator: davidsk

content:
The simplest approach is this: - exit thunderbird - IMPORTANT - copy the appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder elsewhere - after installing the new thunderbird, be sure to EXIT - copy the backedup thunderbird folder to overlay the existing appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder - all messages will be there

Comment: if you are just installing latest version, the backup/restore is not needed (although I do it for safety.)
creator: davidsk

content:
To retain the messages, I assume this is an IMAP account.

  1. click account settings>synchronization&storage and confirm that the accounts can be downloaded
  2. click file>offline>download to ensure that you retrieve all headers and content
  3. install addon, importexporttools NG, if not already done
  4. highlight each account folder, rightclick, select importexport option to export mbox and do so to a windows folder
  5. once done, highlight Local Folders, rightclick, select the importexport option to import mbox for each folder
  6. all folders are now separate from the account and the account can be safely deleted

Comment: Gmail offers 15 gig of free storage, yet you mention that as limited. To my knowledge, that is one of the more generous free accounts. And, you can continue using Thunderbird with Gmail, if desired.
creator: davidsk

content: Just to clarify: thunderbird is only your agent. The request for password is coming from the server and thunderbird is only passing the message on to you. The server says the password is wrong. It may be that your account uses an app password (such as Gmail). For some email accounts, the password used online does not work with a PC.
creator: davidsk

content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
creator: @next
